add_lone_wanderer.bulletin_tile: The wanderer has joined the town!

msg1.message:
But it can also be a new beginning!
Unfortunate tragedy befell this land but it doesn't have to be the end of the story for this town! Someone is bound to stumble upon it soon. Perhaps they might even arrive in time to rescue someone! That would be lucky...

Rebuilding alone might not be an easy task but it surely sounds like a great tale!

[A lone wanderer will join the town some hours from now. Daily Updates will return after a few days]
msg1.message_hard:
Yes, this is the end. Every tale has to get somewhere, and the time has come to sign this page and close this journal one last time... Mistakes were made, lessons were learned, happiness and sadness have both thrived.

The world will go on. Now is the time to rest... Or perhaps it is the perfect opportunity to start a new story?

[Hard Difficulty: Daily Updates will not happen anymore; the town is lost for good]

msg1.message:
They can't help it but notice that something terrible went on...

Taken by concern, they decide to stay and help. There might be survivors? Or perhaps answers of what happened? Or... At the very least a warm bed and some loot, right?

Whatever their motivation, they are staying.

notification.title: Important Warning
notification.message:
The game has failed to find a suitable location to spawn Ogo's Army, but fear not - it will try again!
(Well, I guess you should be afraid, then...)

The game will try looking around for a spot every now and then until it manages to find one, but you can help by expanding your territory a bit! (the revealed area of the map)

This might happen if you're in a very enclosed space or near the edges of the map. You'll get a notification when it manages to find a spot so stay on your guard!

bulletin_message.000:
Our town is now under siege by the mighty goblin army of Ogo Skullbonker and will remain so until they are defeated or run away!

The time for bravery has come!

msg1.message: Ogo Skullbonker is done with our town, for now... But they will come back!

21_residents_reward_c.bulletin_title: The Mason can now craft a 'Clan Amberstone Market Stall'!

21_residents_outro_a.dialogue:
"What a nice home you've built for them! They will be here shortly, and I'm sure they'll be charmed! By the way, I'm certain they can teach you some of our delicious recipes as well..."

They remember one last thing before they leave.

"Oh, and now that some of our kin will be living over here, I feel like some of our merchants might risk going outside, if you let them know they are welcome!"

bulletin_message.00:
The visitor nods and takes their leave.

Shortly after, you discover a basket brimming with soft petals and potted flowers by your banner.

[The visitors seem to trust you more]

"Your wayfaring student of Geomancy has returned as a full-fledged Geomancer! They proved themselves an able practitioner of the magic arts indeed!"

"Here - these precious Hearthbud flowers coalesce traces of Hearth's magic into Hearth Essence, which Geomancers can use in their craft - be sure to tend to their planters."
The Rabbit Geomancer brought some Hearthbud, Hearth Essence, and raw materials along with them, to help start their new aboveground practice.

cougar.description: Definitely not a house cat. Terrifying!

msg1.bulletin_title: A fine-looking merchant approaches with a very exotic caravan!

bulletin_message.00:
"Warm greetings to your settlement! Dom Vandon, ao vosso dispor." He seems to be wearing the finest silk garments and bows with admirable elegance. "Yes, you heard right, the famous merchant! I'm sure you've heard my name before, sim?"

He looks around, clearly analyzing the town in detail before continuing. "Our latest - and most fruitful! - journey has brought us many wonderful goods, most of which are already reserved for the mightiest lords, kings and queens, I'm afraid! However, I sense there's still a good opportunity for business here!"

He smiles, holding some sort of heavy ledger or journal close to his chest.

msg2.bulletin_title: Dom Vandon's Caravan from the Far East

bulletin_message.00:
"I knew I could see it in you, a grande mercador! A visionary! An explorer! Just like Dom Vandon." He frowns his face, tipping his head a bit. "Ehm, no. Not like him, there's no one like him! But many are trying, yes, yes! From the frozen wastes in the north to the serene minds by the southern coast, many adventurous and enterprising individuals are risking their fortunes outside their borders, all after the great deeds of Dom Vandon! The vanguard of a new age!"

He clenches a fist close to his face, proudly staring at the horizon.

"Alas, there is only one Silk Road and its wonders, and that... that is under my autoridade!" He exclaims authoritatively.

msg3.bulletin_title: Dom Vandon's Caravan from the Far East

bulletin_message.00:
"No, no. Not a Silk Road.The Silk Road!" He starts gesturing towards the east. "Go for as long as you can, following the mountains beyond the Pal'Mum sands! Cross barren lands and dangerous steppes towards the sunrise, and there you'll reach it: the eastern kingdoms! Great and beautiful cities with thousands of people, long and winding rivers surrounded by terrace farms of crops or fruits you've never dreamed of..."

A tear rolls down his eye.

"From there you can go further southeast to find the prosperous kingdoms of limestone and spice, full of colorful textiles... or even further east, and you'll be greeted by imperial dynasties as old as the Phoenix Empire!"

msg3b.bulletin_title: Dom Vandon's Caravan from the Far East

bulletin_message.00: "It is! Golden roofed palaces and clay statues the size of an ogre, a hundred cities of jade and ivory will you pass before you reach the sea where the sun is born every morning, home of the island clans with their fine metalwork and combat arts. Survive this whole journey, then travel the entire way back to the west with a caravan of goods... and you'll have riches beyond measure. That is the Silk Road, meu amigo." He sighs, longing to return to the road. "That is Dom Vandon's calling. To explore these distant lands and bring their treasures to everyone!"

msg4.bulletin_title: Dom Vandon's Caravan from the Far East

bulletin_message.00:
"Well, I can't simply bring their unique riches, seeds, and products without giving something in return, amigo! I must offer them something of equal value - our own things that are unique or special to them."

He looks around, contemplating.

"When you're somewhere for your entire life, you start to take some things for granted... but they are not. This is the greatest lesson a grande mercador like Dom Vandon will learn, for it is also the most precious lesson for trading: give others what they don't have, and they'll give you what you want." He scratches his chin, pensive. "So, I might not have much left from the Far East, but I'll definitely need certain things for the journey back..."

msg5.bulletin_title: Dom Vandon's Caravan from the Far East

bulletin_message.00:
"You help Dom Vandon now, providing some of the resources we need for the next journey... and in return Dom Vandon will give you something very special from one of his crates. Seeds for a shiny grass that will grow into delicious grain, Rice." He smiles, opening the big ledger and flipping through some pages.

"With these seeds and some knowledge that I can also provide, as a gesture of good faith, I'm certain that your people will be able to grow their own paddy fields!"

He vigorously extends his hand. "And, of course, Dom Vandon never forgets those that helped him! I might even bring something different in the future, yes? What say you, amigo?"

skip.bulletin_title: Dom Vandon's Caravan from the Far East

bulletin_message.00:
"Oh, it's understandable."

He shrugs, seemingly not worried at all - almost as if refusal was expected.

"The path to greatness is not for everyone, of course. Some people are just happy the way they are, with the things they already have, without dreaming of more. Ahh, but one day..." He looks up, hopeful. "One day the world will feel small, and everyone will have everything from everywhere, amigo! Write this down... Dom Vandon is starting a new age!" He looks down again, back to his unworried face.

"I thought this could be different, but sometimes even a visionary must take a step back... Stay safe, little town!"

dom_vandon_arrival_quest.title: Supplies for Dom Vandon's Caravan
dom_vandon_arrival_quest.text: Dom Vandon gave us a small list of some resources they need for the next crossing of the Silk Road. In return, he'll teach us how to cultivate Rice - and might even bring other goods from the Far East in the future!

msg1.bulletin_title: Dom Vandon's Caravan from the Far East

bulletin_message.00:
The fine-looking merchant approaches, worried about the delay on delivering him his request.

"Is everything alright, amigo? Do I notice a slight lack of interest in being part of the future and the dawn of a new age on your part?" He checks some values on his ledger before closing it and looking at everyone that gathered around him.

"It is not a problem; I'll understand if your town has different priorities. But please, if this is the case, let Dom Vandon know it right now so he can move on with his caravan. Are you still interested in our deal?"

"Look who is back, meu amigo! And, as promised, Dom Vandon brings you an incredible gift!" He presents a large crate full of seedbags and some notes.

"This is paddy, a type of grass that must grow on water but will provide you with rice, a delicious and starchy grain! Yes, rice is known - and many merchants will sell it... But now you may plant your own! Besides, rice flour is very versatile, you see... and can be used both as a hard or soft flour! Dom Vandon was fascinated the day he discovered this eastern delicacy and he's sure your people will be, too!" He points to his own head. "And that's not all!"

msg2.bulletin_title: Dom Vandon's Caravan from the Far East

bulletin_message.00:
"You've proven yourself to be a reliable business partner!" He smiles, checking something on his ledger once more. He then retrieves a fine quill and starts writing something and, without looking, he continues speaking. "There are many journeys and caravans to take care of; Dom Vandon must never linger on the same place for too long! However, he'll definitely let his caravaneers know that this settlement can be trusted from now on! Which means that they might come looking for supplies or products that are very interesting for the eastern kingdoms..."

He finishes writing, drops the quill and closes the ledger, finally looking back up. "And in return they might bring more exotic goods!"

msg3.bulletin_title: Dom Vandon's Caravan from the Far East

bulletin_message.00:
"Yes! Tea, coffee, intricate crafts like decorations, building parts..." He raises his brows. "Even weapons and armor; they have very unique equipment that will surely be useful to your people, meu amigo!"

He gestures down, displaying his own fine-looking and exotic garments.

"Well, it has been a pleasure, but the road awaits! Remember, help the caravans as much as you can, and Dom Vandon promises that it will be worth your time! Never a bad deal with this grande mercador!"

He smiles before pacing away. "Goodbye, and until the next meeting!"

"Dom Vandon has returned, meu amigo, and he must admit he has been hearing some excellent news about your settlement!" He looks into some of his notes for a moment.

"Sim, sim, it seems you have been been very helpful to Dom Vandon's smaller caravans and, because of that, you may now choose a gift!" You notice two large crates of seeds being carried over by his assistants. "These seeds will provide you with a permanent source of the two most exquisite and flavorful beverages, coffee and tea! And no worries! Today you may only get one but in the future Dom Vandon may provide the other... Make your choice, meu amigo!"

coffee.bulletin_title: Dom Vandon's Caravan from the Far East

bulletin_message.00:
"Ah, an excellent choice! Dom Vandon's favorite!" He grins and writes something on his big ledger with a fancy quill.

"Coffee plants will provide you with interesting fruits full of energy! A Farmer can cultivate them, but it is the Brewer that will select, dry, and then roast the beans, grind 'em, and finally sack 'em. Coffee-based beverages are full of energy and speed, causing your people to move and work faster and even sleep less! Just... Be careful to not drink too much of it!" He laughs.

tea.bulletin_title: Dom Vandon's Caravan from the Far East

bulletin_message.00:
"What a wonderful choice! Dom Vandon's favorite!" He grins and writes something on his big ledger with a fancy quill.

"Tea shrubs will provide you with nice smelling and very green leaves! A Farmer can cultivate them, but it is the Brewer that will steam and dry them, a process that can lead to green or black tea leaves! Teas are relaxing and great for focusing, causing your people to be more diligent, learn faster, and be more patient when crafting... which might make it a bit slower, but the results will be superb!" He smiles.

"It's good to see you again, meu amigo!" He arrives with a crate of seeds.

"Dom Vandon will always fulfill his promises! Your town has been an excellent business partner, that's all Dom Vandon hears from his caravaneers!" He smiles with satisfaction before opening the crate. "Tea shrubs! A Farmer can cultivate them, but it is the Brewer that will steam and dry them, a process which can lead to green or black tea leaves! Teas are relaxing and great for focusing, causing your people to be more diligent, learn faster, and be more patient when crafting... which might make it a bit slower, but the results will be superb!" He smiles. "Dom Vandon hopes you'll enjoy this delicacy from the eastern lands!"

"It's good to see you again, meu amigo!" He arrives with a crate of seeds.

"Dom Vandon will always fulfill his promises! Your town has been an excellent business partner, that's all Dom Vandon hears from his caravaneers!" He smiles with satisfaction before opening the crate. "Coffee plants! A Farmer can cultivate them, but it is the Brewer that will select, dry, and then roast the beans, grind 'em, and finally sack 'em. Coffee-based beverages are full of energy and speed, causing your people to move and work faster and even sleep less! Just... Be careful to not drink too much of it!" He laughs. "Dom Vandon hopes you'll enjoy this delicacy from the south-eastern lands!"

msg1.bulletin_title: Dom Vandon is back one more time!

bulletin_message.00:
"Ah, it's good to be back, meu amigo!" He takes in some fresh air and, for the first time, genuinely seems to be enjoying the scenery and not merely checking something on his ledger. "Dom Vandon doesn't even need to check his numbers to know that this town has been an excellent partner, one that owes nothing to all the great port cities and trade hubs his caravans have been to!"

With a smile, he extends his hand. "In fact, your town should no longer be just a helper to Dom Vandon, no, no. From now on, you're a client! A proper, full fledged client of the Dom Vandon's Silk Road Caravans!"

msg2.bulletin_title: Dom Vandon's Caravan from the Far East

bulletin_message.00:
"You did more than good, meu grande amigo! You did great!" He raises a finger, speaking excitedly. "Dom Vandon is a strong believer that great friendships can be formed over coins, and the best friendships will bring even more coins!" He chuckles, but you can tell he really believes that, at least a little.

"And that is why Dom Vandon thinks it is now time to tell his caravans to stop coming by just for a few goods or supplies... and instead allow your people to build a Caravanserai!"

msg3.bulletin_title: Dom Vandon's Caravan from the Far East

bulletin_message.00: "Yes! A Caravanserai! That is the name given to exclusive resting stations that our biggest caravans may use during their journeys back and forth to the far east. They are special structures for our most exclusive merchants, like Dom Vandon himself! And there we can trade our whole inventory, not just a few goods!" He opens his arms, welcoming. "Your town is now an esteemed client of the Silk Road Caravans, que fortuna! You shall soon be trading with the whole world! The future is here!" He bows before starting to move away. "It has been a pleasure, amigo! And may your pockets always be filled!"

tier_1_returning_silk_road_encounter.title: A small far eastern caravan is passing through!
tier_1_returning_silk_road_encounter.trade_details:

It seems to be a small caravan in service to Dom Vandon, on its way back from the Silk Road with a few articles from the eastern kingdoms. They are offering [str(i18n_data.reward_number)] [str(i18n_data.reward_item)] if we provide them with [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)] for their next journey.

tier_1_returning_silk_road_encounter.return_greetings_positive: "Greetings again! It seems your [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)] are ready to be traded for my [str(i18n_data.reward_number)] [str(i18n_data.reward_item)]! We should proceed with the deal, yes?"
tier_1_returning_silk_road_encounter.return_greetings_negative:
"We're about to proceed back into the Silk Road and it seems you've not procured us [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)]. It's alright... Look for our caravan again in the future, yes, yes."

They start leaving.

tier_2_returning_silk_road_encounter.return_title: The caravaneer from the far east returns!
tier_2_returning_silk_road_encounter.return_greetings_positive: "Hello, friend! Looks like your [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)] are good to go! I brought our [str(i18n_data.reward_number)] [str(i18n_data.reward_item)]! Shake hands?"
tier_2_returning_silk_road_encounter.return_greetings_negative:

tier_3_returning_silk_road_encounter.return_title: The caravaneer from the far east returns!
tier_3_returning_silk_road_encounter.return_greetings_positive: "We're back, my friends! And it seems you have the [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)] ready and packed for us! Here is the [str(i18n_data.reward_number)] [str(i18n_data.reward_item)] we promised! We keeping the deal, yes?"

They start leaving.
