bulletin_message.00:
The goblin approaches, revealing herself to be a bit shorter than expected. "BONES! BONES!" she shouts in a playful, almost childish voice.

"BOOOONEEES!" she continues.

She seems to be harmless.

Is that a child? Are there goblin children?

She's clearly happy about it, hopping around in circles. "BONES! BONES! MANY BONES!"

Suddenly, a stern and yet compassionate hearthling voice rumbles nearby. "There you are, Rattley!"

He wears the colors of the Northern Alliance. Strong and grizzled, he rests his hand on the head of the little goblin. "So there you are! Going out and making friends, eh?"

He notices the people around. "I apologize. Name's Thorulf, traveler and former Scout of the Library."

With a gentle pat the goblin goes back to jumping around.

"What?" he thunders. "No, don't call her a pet! She's a goblin - not a squirrel. They're people too, you know?"

He coughs, waving his hand as an apology.

"I apologize. It's just... We've been through a lot, Rattley and I." He looks in her direction as she plays with a small bone club. "Unfortunately, not many places are prepared to accept or at least try to understand goblins..."

"Rattley is like a daughter to me," he says with a bittersweet smile, "I am the reason she is alone in the world, and she is the reason I left the Library. Each of us watches over the other now!" he laughs, shoving the past back where it belongs.

"I know you're busy, so we'll go find a place to camp for a few days!" He waves his hand, calling Rattley closer.

"Oh, I almost forgot..." he scratches the back of his head and smirks. "I'll be busy setting up camp and won't have time to hunt very soon... Would you mind gifting little Rattley a couple of bones?"

The little goblin reacts enthusiastically. "BONES! GIVE BONES!"

Thorulf stares back at her "Rattley, what have I told you?".

She looks down. "Please?"

Thorulf smiles. "We would appreciate it, she loves carving them!"

"Good!" he exclaims, before turning around. "We'll be nearby. Stay warm!"

They start walking away.

bone_gift_quest.title: Bones for Rattley
bone_gift_quest.text: The little goblin loves carving things out of bone!

bulletin_message.00:
She quickly grabs the materials. "BONES! BONES!"

Behind her, Thorulf is finishing setting up the camp. "Rattley, thank them for the gift!"

She looks back before continuing. "BONES! You make Rattley happy!"

"Greetings once more, friends!" says the northerner as he puts a small bowl for feeding pets by your banner. "Rattley is showing herself to be a very promising bone carver!"

"BONES!" She seems very happy and grateful.

Thorulf seems very proud. "We think you should have her latest creation."

Thorulf looks around, scratching his mustache. "You folks from the southern lands are not accustomed to carving bones."

He raises his brows, clearly having an idea. "I'm teaching Rattley, one more apprentice wouldn't hurt. We'll go on a hunting trip soon and I can teach a Mason, if willing." He smiles. "All I ask is some supplies for the days we'll be gone."

"AND BONES!" cheers Rattley.

"You welcome!" says Rattley with a smile.

Thorulf pats her on the head before continuing, "She is a great apprentice. Bone carving is an art as ancient as the stars, very important to my people." He rests his hand over his heart. "Curiously enough it's also a tradition for the goblins."

Thorulf seems a bit disappointed.

"Well, I'm sure you know what's best for your people!" He smiles and takes a deep breath. "We'll go on our hunting trip and move on afterwards. We might come around here sometime soon if you wish to reconsider!"

He nods and turns around to leave as Rattley waves goodbye to everyone.

Thorulf rejoices, "Hah, good! I knew you'd appreciate the invitation. It's hard to not appreciate intricate bone craftsmanship!"

"BONES!" cheers Rattley once more, "BONE FRIEND!"

"We will head back to our camp; send your Mason our way whenever they're ready!"

Thorulf sighs, "Well, sometimes things just get in the way, eh?" He smiles. "But I'm sure our paths shall cross again. Rattley surely wants them to."

"BONE FRIEND!" she cheers.

"Maybe next time we're around we could even teach you a bit about bone carving! Well, off we go!"

hunting_trip_supplies_quest.title: Supplies for the trip
hunting_trip_supplies_quest.dialog_title: They'll need some food and some bones for Rattley.
hunting_trip_supplies_quest.text: And a tonic or two. Just for safety!

mason_dispatch_quest.text: Select a Mason (Level 2+) to learn Bone Carving with Thorulf and Rattley!
mason_dispatch_quest.title: Select a Mason

bulletin_message.00:
"BONES!" she cheers, as she jumps around the town banner. "We back, bone friend!"

Behind her, Thorulf and the Mason calmly approach while having a friendly conversation.

"There you go!" says Thorulf as they approach, laughing, "Your Mason is back safely, well fed and full of knowledge to share!"

Rattley silently approaches and clings to her father's leg, as he continues, "I'm afraid it is time to say goodbye, now. Hopefully this knowledge will serve you very well from now on."

He smiles. "May the stars always shine the brightest upon your town. Farewell!"

bone_recipes_unlock.bulletin_title: New Bone Carving recipes for the Mason!

bulletin_message.00:
"Many greetings! It seems our paths have crossed again," he says, smiling.

Rattley jumps in front of him. "BONE FRIEND!"

She laughs and Thorulf continues, "She insisted on coming. We have a proposition!" He shows some of his own bone carved tools as he elaborates, "We're going on another hunting trip nearby and maybe a Mason would be interested in learning bone carving?"

"Good to know you're interested!" He smiles, opening his arms wide. "We can leave as soon as you're ready. But since we'll be out for a couple of days, some supplies wouldn't hurt... if that's alright!"

Rattley waves from behind his legs. "AND BONES!"

"And bones, of course!" he laughs.

"Oh, I understand." He gives a gentle yet disappointed smile.

"No bones?" Rattley sobs.

"Maybe next time, right? I'm sure they must be very busy. Sometimes this is just how things are!" He seems genuinely interested in teaching others; maybe someday he'll return.

"We wish you the best of luck, and may the stars always shine upon your town!"

bulletin_message.000: I'm fading fast, but I have given the last of my spirit to this egg of the Great Dragon, so that the dragonling inside may finally hatch into this world. I have known you for very little time, Children of Monkey, but I trust you will aid this young whelp as you have aided me. May you carry yourselves with strength and compassion, as the Dragonborn once did.

That's interesting! Apparently the copper dragon whelp we pledged to protect as the last wish of Flox Icedragon, the Dragonborn King... is growing! How large will it get? Will it ever fly? Will it be a fire hazard? So many questions! We must wait and see...

msg1.choice_000: Let's hope we have enough food!

bulletin_message.000: "Greetings, friends... Our family. We are finally grown enough to speak to your minds and hearts." Although surprising, there's a warm and fuzzy feeling inside everyone as [str(i18n_data.pet_custom_name)]'s voice rumbles in their heads. "We want to thank all of you for taking care of us and for the name you've all given us, [str(i18n_data.pet_custom_name)]. However, you must know that this is not our real name. While we gladly and lovingly accept it, the time has come to embrace our lineage..." He pauses for a brief moment. "We are Cadmus'ytrax, the last heir of the Great Dragon. We are a prince."

[str(i18n_data.pet_custom_name)] releases a long, deep laugh before resuming in a friendlier tone: "Indeed, we can talk. We are no longer a whelp! We understand your awe before this... revelation. It's a perfectly understandable reaction for the quaint and quick lives of the Children of Monkey. We mean no offense, of course." Somehow everyone can tell he's smiling. "We'll be forever grateful for the ultimate act of love and kindness provided by this town to the last Dragonborn King and to us. But a prince has duties that can not be ignored."

msg2.dialog_title: His voice is more serious now

bulletin_message.000: "This knowledge might be too complex for most mortal beings..." He measures his words carefully. "Dragons are connected, joined together like the links of a chain, the threads in a bolt of cloth. In many ways we are one, our consciousnesses merged. We learn from each other, share our memories, our history and our bonds through each other. Cadmus'ytrax is in every dragon, and so are they part of Cadmus'ytrax. Our kin now knows of our survival - the Great Dragon's lineage is not gone." He sighs deeply, lost in thought. "And we now know of our remaining brethren: scattered, hiding, leaderless and lost since the Great Purge."

msg3.dialog_title: His deep voice suddenly gets somber

bulletin_message.000: "The Great Purge. Eons ago we were many. Respected, feared, loved. Under the guidance of the mighty Dragonborn Empire, dragons and dragonborn ruled the land ahead of the cycles of Rabbit, Snake or Monkey - before the rise of the Phoenix itself." He pauses, observing the impact of his words on the gathered listeners. "The world was very different. Raw, chaotic, unfathomable planar forces still challenging the very existence of life in what your folk only recalls as their most primitive stages, prior to recorded history. A world torn by conflict above any living beings... And between these cosmic forces and fresh mortal lives was our kin."

"Dragons and our shepherds - the Dragonborn - were divine creations. The first life, works of art... But soon it became clear that this world was not meant for us. The deities started bickering with each other and isolating themselves with their own new creations. Many cycles rose and waned as their greedy eyes were set upon us." Silence. A deep pain seems to encroach within. "As they thrived, cults formed and entire populations turned against all dragonkin. They hunted us, razed our great cities, and destroyed our lineages. As more and more cycles passed, the Dragonborn Empire fell to nothing but ashes. The last dragons in hiding, barely surviving, their scales now prized by emperors and khans..."

"Yes, we share a sad tale. We still feel the pain of each of our ancestors ingrained in our collective memory... But do not be sorry! These memories are as distant and forgotten as sand in a sandstorm, now." He seems to be more cheerful. "Nothing lasts forever, and the hubris of the Dragonborn - our own - prevented us from prevailing. We need not rebuild an empire, but perhaps it is not too late to come together and find our place as part of this new world. Our brethren have waited far too long for this and we feel this is our responsibility. We are the last of the Great Dragon's lineage. We can reunite the dragons and lead them to a place where they will not be seen as prizes nor as monsters."

"Well, yes. But not now. We're still growing, learning, and understanding our world." The warm and fuzzy feeling inside comes back. "For now we shall remain [str(i18n_data.pet_custom_name)], your folk's loved and prized companion. But when the time comes we shall talk again: there's a lot you must know before we go. Until then we shall fight for this town to protect it, protect our family!"

msg1.bulletin_title: The deep voice of [str(i18n_data.pet_custom_name)] echoes again!
msg1.dialog_title: Both joy and sadness in his words

bulletin_message.000: "The time has come. We must soon leave this dear family we found within the Children of Monkey... We feel stronger and wiser than ever." There's some comfort in these words. "However, before we leave, we have a gift for all of you. A very important one."

msg1.choice_001: Do you really have to go?

question.bulletin_title: The deep voice of [str(i18n_data.pet_custom_name)] echoes again!

bulletin_message.000: "Yes, dear town. We understand you shall all miss [str(i18n_data.pet_custom_name)], your lovely 'pet'... But there's something much greater than any of us at stake... We speak of the survival and the struggle of our own kin, an entire species. We dragons can be so much more for this world, so much more than what the deities that abandoned us ever expected. We are the historians of this world, the librarians of its living memory and perception. Our collective consciousness can serve a much higher purpose if we earn our place back among the mortals. We must try."

msg2.bulletin_title: The deep voice of [str(i18n_data.pet_custom_name)] echoes again!

bulletin_message.000: "Yes! We have made a monument with rock, fire and many of our own scales that we shed as we grew..." His voice seems full of pride. "We were great crafters once, back in our age. We've lit furnaces higher than mountains and worked rivers of molten metals with the flick of our claws and the blowing winds of our wings... We believe that this monument honors such a legacy." He pauses for a brief moment. "A Dragon Shrine that represents the friendship between this town and our kin. As long as it stands and our chromatic flame remains lit within it, others will know you're worthy."

msg3.bulletin_title: The deep voice of [str(i18n_data.pet_custom_name)] echoes again!
msg3.dialog_title: His voice is strong and decided

bulletin_message.000: "Our quest will be long and dangerous. It will be the labor of more than a single mortal lifetime to bring all the dragons back together and earn the respect of all others, earn our place in this world. Even when away, we'll still need your support: we might find other dragons or dragon eggs that will need love and caring - just like you provided us with. We must know there is a safe place for our kin, towns like yours that will start to forge a new bond between dragonkin and mortals by protecting us and showing the world that we are also part of it." His voice rumbles with spite. "And with so many Dragon Cultists out there, we'll definitely need that safety."

msg4.bulletin_title: The deep voice of [str(i18n_data.pet_custom_name)] echoes again!
msg4.dialog_title: There's an edge to his voice

bulletin_message.000: "Yes, they've been around since time immemorial... They've changed over the ages, acted under a thousand different names, banners, and credos... But always following the same ideals: necromancy, corruption, and dragons as weapons, vessels of destruction..." [str(i18n_data.pet_custom_name)] pauses, pensive. "I'm afraid they still exist, their terrible magic preserved through the ages, their cursed masks still a symbol of the chaos they bring about. Sooner or later, they will find you - and your town must stand against them! As long as the Dragon Shrine stands and its flame is lit, Dragon Cultists might attack the town!"

msg5.bulletin_title: The deep voice of [str(i18n_data.pet_custom_name)] echoes again!

bulletin_message.000: "Do not despair, brave ones! We want them to come... By collecting their masks and giving them to our allies, we'll make sure that new dragons can be hatched by your town and help you defend against their threat! Their masks are highly valuable artifacts for them, providing them with incognito spells to hide their identities, forgotten spells that can no longer be created. The more masks we destroy, the safer the world will be for future dragons! That must be our purpose... Get the Shrine up, defend against cultists, and retrieve dragon eggs from our allies by sending us their masks!"

msg6.bulletin_title: The deep voice of [str(i18n_data.pet_custom_name)] echoes again!

bulletin_message.000: A warm yet sad feeling permeates the town. "It is time to say farewell, then. We know how difficult this can be for mortals. But we dragonkin share our existence with our own so none of us is ever truly gone. We keep all the memories of our last moments within our collective memories - and all the memories of this town and all of you will now be forever ingrained in the history of dragons. We are a part of you, and you'll always be a part of us. '[str(i18n_data.pet_custom_name)]' will never forget your kindness, Children of Monkey. And now Cadmus'ytrax rises!" The dragon soars above the town for all to see against the sky, the wings spread in gratitude as he looks down all around. "And may we meet again, one day!"

quest_cultist_masks.title: An ally of dragons approaches us in secret!
quest_cultist_masks.text: "Greetings from Cadmus, our mutual friend! Any masks from the cultists to contribute to our cause, brothers and sisters?"

quest_reward.title: The ally of dragons departs with the masks
quest_reward.message:
With everyone's support - including our town's - little by little we'll help dragons earn their place in this world!

[Dragonkin reputation increased]

dragon_offer_reward.title: Cadmus'ytrax flies away!
dragon_offer_reward.message: Before leaving, he gently and carefully places something next to the town banner:

bulletin_message.000:
Our former companion reappears above our town, shinier and bigger than ever!
"Warm greetings, dear friends! We're sorry this is a brief visit but we're here to share good news! Finding and uniting our kin has been a success so far, but unfortunately, we often find... orphaned eggs. Would you be interested in one of them, to care and love our whelp as you once did for us?" He smiles gently.
bulletin_message.001:
Cadmus approaches at an imposing but respectful pace!
"Salutations, beloved family! Unfortunately, we may not stay for too long... But we bring good tidings! We have accomplished much as the prince of dragons so far, but unfortunately, we often find... orphaned eggs. Would you be interested in one of them, to care and love our whelp as you once did for us?" He smiles excitedly.
bulletin_message.002:
Our beloved 'pet' returns home, bright and strong!
"Greetings, old friends! We hope this is an appropriate time for good news! Our task is a long and difficult one; however, it has been a success so far! Unfortunately, we often find... orphaned eggs. Would you be interested in one of them, to care and love our whelp as you once did for us?" He smiles kindly.
bulletin_message.003:
The dragon hovers above the town, admired by all!
"Warm greetings, family! We apologize it's been so long, but we bring news! We've been quite busy uniting and bringing together all the remaining dragons, but unfortunately, we often find... orphaned eggs. Would you be interested in one of them, to care and love our whelp as you once did for us?" He smiles gratefully.
bulletin_message.004:
He comes forth with an imposing yet gentle attitude!
"It's good to be back! We've missed all of you, Children of Monkey... We bring good tidings! There's not a single day that we don't dedicate to bringing our kin back together, but unfortunately, we often find... orphaned eggs. Would you be interested in one of them, to care and love our whelp as you once did for us?" He smiles.

bulletin_message.000: "We knew we could count on you! We can always count on our closest kin. We trust you'll take good care of them! Which one would you like?"

"We understand, friends. Raising a dragon is no easy task and we're not always prepared for such a responsibility... Well, we shall return some other time; as long as the shrine is lit, we'll always count on you! Take care, and may destiny be kind to your town!"

adv_returning_trader_encounter.title: A member of the Adventurer's Guild approaches.
adv_returning_trader_encounter.waiting_title: The Adventurer's Guild will be back in [str(i18n_data.hour_counter)] [str(i18n_data.period)]!
adv_returning_trader_encounter.waiting_text: The Adventurer's Guild member will be back in [str(i18n_data.hour_counter)] [str(i18n_data.period)] to give you [str(i18n_data.reward_number)] [str(i18n_data.reward_item)] if you turn in [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)] ([str(i18n_data.req_1.quantity)])!
adv_returning_trader_encounter.return_greetings_positive: Glory and wonder, friend! It seems you have the [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)] the Guild wanted. We're willing to give you [str(i18n_data.reward_number)] [str(i18n_data.reward_item)] in return for the trophies. Do we have a deal?
adv_returning_trader_encounter.return_greetings_negative: The Adventurer's Guild has sent me back but I see you didn't procure the [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)] we wanted. We'll return in some days with a new offer. Follow the path of fame, friend!

adv_returning_trader_encounter_1.trade_details: Glory and wonder, friends of [str(i18n_data.town_name)]! I come in the name of the Adventurer's Guild to make an offer for some adventure trophies. We're currently looking for [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)] and will provide [str(i18n_data.reward_item)] in return. You'd have [str(i18n_data.num_days)] days to gather these before we're back, sounds interesting enough? We'll return with a different offer should you refuse.

bulletin_message.00:
An elderly woman fully dressed as a cook approaches with a smile. "Oh, hello there, dearie. You wouldn't mind if I stopped here for a moment, would you? Of course not, you seem like a real sweetie. I'm Grandma Chenba, the itinerant cooking matriarch of the desert, but you may call me Grandma."

She looks around, apparently satisfied. "I've been traveling for many years now, spreading the delicacies of the Rayya's Children cuisine and my own special recipes... You have to try my cookies!"

"Oh, I feel very welcome, dearie! Don't worry about me..." She takes a moment to breath, visibly tired. "It's these old bones! They're making the 'itinerant' part of my job a little more challenging lately."

She seems to catch some smell in the air and is immediately drawn to it "Oh, I can smell very promising food, yes. Whoever is cooking has a long road ahead, though... Not a dangerous one, mind you, but a very tasty one!" She giggles kindly and pauses for a moment, tapping a finger against her chin as if deciding what we'll have for lunch... "It might help to learn some important things early on, if you're interested. How to organize your kitchen, how to be a good baker, and how to preserve your food!"

"Oh, I will! You youngsters nowadays... Always impatient!" She shakes her head. "Don't worry dearie, I was planning on telling you these things all along!" She takes off her glasses, cleaning them for a moment.

"The first thing a master cook must know is how to organize their kitchen. Discipline and companionship help, of course, but the real secret is in dividing the tasks. Did you know you can tell your cooks to focus on different recipe categories? In fact, I'm sure this tip is useful for every other crafter, depending on the situation. Just pray make sure to never have a category with no one assigned..."

You can disable or enable crafters by clicking the small head icons to the right of each category in the workshop's recipe list.

"It is very useful, dearie. With an organized kitchen, you could have someone focusing only on baking, for example." You see a light shining on her eyes.

"And this is a good idea since baking is a very complex process, but it results in sophisticated, delicious recipes! Most baking recipes will start with flour and then a kneaded dough, which must rise before it can be used." She watches you carefully, making sure you're listening. "You need a good surface for that, so remember to create a leavening table. Doughs will rise fast, in a matter of hours, but only when they're done rising you'll be able to use them. No one wants a sunken bread!" She smiles. "And workload balance is essential, because doughs can spoil quite quickly!"

"Oh, it's not that bad, dearie! But it is definitely important! Food preservation is something that I've learned from my own grandma since I was a little girl with a rolling pin chasing cactuslings away from her pies." She giggles, looking away while reminiscing her old times. "Just having the food be properly stored in any kind of container like a crate or chest will already give it some extra time, but what you'll really want is a proper cooling box! Most masons or potters can craft one... And if you can ever afford it, an engineer is able to create proper refrigerators. These will keep food preserved for a long, long time."

She rubs her hands together, satisfied. "I've never served a meal that didn't look fresh and delicious! And nor should you! Fresh food is healthy food!"

"Oh, did we, dearie?" She giggles graciously. "I'm sorry, I'm no spring poyo anymore, as you can probably tell! But pray know that I do not mean to offend, it just happens sometimes." She gestures an apology and places a hand upon her own heart.

"If we did meet, then I'm sure you already know everything about organizing your kitchen, baking and preserving food! Now, I love talking to you youngters, so full of life and potential! If you'd still want to hear me 'babble' a little about these things..." She smiles, her rosy cheeks gently lifting her spectacles up a bit. "Just let Grandma Chenba know, yes?"

"Indeed! Cooking is an art, dearie. But it is also a skill and can be practiced and improved. Everyone dreams about their grandmothers' cookies, pies, and cakes, but they forget that they too may be a grandparent one day." She chuckles, her eyes full of kindness.

"Your young and aspiring cook will do wonders, I'm sure of it! So pray hold this advice close to your heart, sweetie. Organize your kitchen, let doughs rise on a leavening table and preserve your ingredients and your food! Nothing brings people together like a home-cooked meal!"

She sighs, holding her own back for a moment. "Now, if you'll allow me, I must rest for a day before I return to the road..."

"Um, hello?

Oh, there you are! I'm Bruno, the most famous and accomplished fisherman of the realm! Or at least of this realm..."

He shakes his backpack full of fishing equipment.

"I was 'trolling through the area, but I'm afraid I've sold the last fish to your neighbors..." He shrugs and then suddenly straightens his face, thinking of something. "Well, I'm actually also hooked on buying fish! No trout about it, sometimes I buy just for the halibut! You could probably net some if you have, let's say, a trapper..."

So you do want to get into fishing, eh? Well, of course you can easily get some fish if you have a skilled fisher..." Bruno points to the fancy fishing rod on his back. "But if you don't, you can still have your highly nutritious fish by trapping them with Fish Traps! And I assure you they are very nutritious. And tasty... And juicy... Mmmm..."

He looks distracted for a moment.

"Oh, right. Fish traps! So, would you like to know the catch?"

"Okay, let's reel in that enthusiasm, shall we? I tease, I like enthusiasm! WOOOO!

Anyway, it's quite simple! If you check with your trapper, you'll notice that they can probably place a Fish Trap. These must be placed on the edges of water bodies like lakes or rivers - you won't even be able to place them in the wrong place! Once placed, your trapper will do some work to get it set up, and soon enough it will start attracting our slippery friends!
Hmmm... I probably shouldn't call them friends if I'm going to eat them..."

"It does! But that's just a drop in the ocean; I don't want to drown you with all my knowledge." He scratches his chin for a second. "However I should probably school you on a few other things! One is that you don't always have to harvest the meat of the fish you get! By interacting with the trap's anchor, you'll notice that you can tell the trapper to just capture the fish instead. This allows you to release it somewhere else, creating your own aquarium or pond!
Just... don't try releasing them on land..."

"About their use... Once set up, a trap will work by itself, and the trapper will just have to check it every now and then like their other traps. Fish Traps will provide not only fish but also things like fish roe! Just remember to not place them too close to one another: that can reduce their efficiency..."

He punches the air with excitement.

"And that's it, you're ready to start swimming up the great river of fishing!"

"Oh, maybe. I know a lot of folks! Every now and then we break from the reef and back again... Sometimes I feel like I have a fish memory with people, heh. So forgive me if I didn't recognize you!
I feel kind of bad now...
Anyway, I suppose you wouldn't be interested in a tip or two about Fish Traps, then? I cod give them now if you want, just let minnow!"

"Great, now we're all caught up! Feel free to drop me a line anytime! I'll probably slack off here for now... I don't mean to sound fishy, just need to relax a bit by the fire and then I'll continue my journey tomorrow! And hopefully you'll be doing some catches so we can trade next time I swim around. Gotta aim for those net-gains!"

Bruno gives you a very excited thumbs up.

"Thanks for the hospitality!"

A strong man with a waxed mustache prances into town. "Hah! There you are! No, no need to get up. I found the lack of smoke columns disturbing! Even thought that this settlement was abandoned! Where are the smelters? The kilns? The ovens with delicious empanadas?!"

He dramatically shakes his fists to the skies and silence reigns before he coughs and speaks with a more serious tone.
"Pardon me, pollito. I am Fernand the Great, master smith and wordsmith. Now, I might be el maestro only at the forge, but do you know what is common between the simplest cook or herbalist and the mightiest smith, pollito?"

"They work with fire!" He gestures with passion. "And fire needs fuel! As the legendary Lucan Varius once said, the strongest fire needs the purest fuel! And believe me, I know a lot about that." He looks around, proudly. "This is a young town but I sense good things about it. Fernand is good with that too, be assured, pollito. I'll tell you what..."

The smith curls his mustache with one finger, thinking.
"I happened to be passing by with some traders, looking for new customers. Fernand always needs new customers. I could teach you a lot about fuels now - and maybe one day you'll be a good customer too, suena bien?"

"That's the spirit!"
He crosses his arms, lecturing with confidence.

"Well, pollito, fuel is essential for many workshops and tools that require a fire to function. It's also important for certain light or heat sources like fire pits or braziers - but not all. There are mainly three grades of fuel: Lower Grade, like Firewood or Peat; Good Grade like Charcoal or Lumps o' Coal, and High Grade, like Hard Coal."

He continues. "Together, lower and good grade fuels are called Common Fuels. Simple things like heating water for preparing a tonic might only need a lower grade fuel, but more complex things like smelting metals will require better ones!"

"It's always important to know what fuel you need, pollito! Interacting with any of these workbenches will let you see what types of fuel they accept and even select the ones that you want to use. No point in wasting good coal to fry an egg, hah!" He bursts in laughter. "Many fuels can be acquired from natural sources like cutting trees or mining. But the most efficient fuels are the crafted ones! A single log can become Firewood in the hands of a Carpenter or Charcoal in the hands of a Blacksmith. And we, maestros del fuego, masters of the fire, can create the best fuels.

I know, you're probably wondering how to wield such power!"

"I must say, it is easier than it sounds! No, it's not because I'm already an accomplished, renowned and generally amazing blacksmith. It really is simple!" He smiles, posing. "Once a workshop is built and its fuel types are chosen, pretty much anyone can help with keeping it fueled! You don't need to be an artisan like Fernand to dump some coal into a fire, no! All workers and citizens will help in keeping your workshops fueled, as long as you have fuel available. Oh!" He remembers something. "And you don't have to worry about wasting it either. Fuel barely burns when not being used, you'll only spend it when something is crafted!"

"Remember, pollito! The real secret for mastering el arte of fuel is to optimize! Learn which fuels are more efficient, which ones provides you with more crafts per unit, which ones are best for each purpose and always keep them close to their respective workbenches by using supply tables or shelves! Nothing beats the smell of burning coal in the morning, and having your fuel readily available is essential for any crafter that wants to work with no interruptions!"

He pats you on the shoulder, proudly.

"Pollito you're now on your way to greatness, I'm sure!"

"Hmmm, maybe!" He ponders over it for a second. "Or perhaps you've seen a painting of me. Fernand is quite famous, you know. Very famous!"

He rests his strong hands on his waist, smiling.

"But if we've talked before, forgive me for not recalling - too many promising towns, aspiring apprentices, and naughty rivals to keep track of!" He laughs. "Either way, if you want I could give you some advice on fuels and how crafters use them!"

"Very well, very well." He stretches his back and moves his neck around. "Being a master smith can be taxing sometimes! I'll spend some time around, meet the townsfolk and share tales by the fire, if you don't mind! It was un placer, pollito!"

He smiles.

"No need to worry, I won't cause any trouble other than a few broken hearts, and will be leaving tomorrow... And mark my words! Fernand the Great shall visit and trade with the good people of [str(i18n_data.town_name)] one day!

A grizzled warrior approaches wearing old and dented platemail beneath a beautiful cloth tabard. "I extend to you my greetings, fellows." He bows his head with a hand to his heart. "I am Sir Edmund, acclaimed battle-cleric of the old Order of the Knights of Cid, and I've come to offer my services to your growing settlement."

He looks around with peaceful eyes, but his face and hair suggest a far more eventful past.
"Oh, do I arouse suspicion? I apologize." He carries no more than a healing staff. "I wield no arms anymore and have sworn an oath to wander the lands, offering my services to all who need them, regardless of kin or faith."

"I appreciate the hospitality, friend." He bows once more. "Anyway,herbalism and healing are arts that have been lost in these troubled times; few can perform them as well as they could a while ago..." You hear a slight disappointment on his tone. "Times of peace can be deceiving, fellows, for no one can truly tell how long they will last. And even if long, age and sickness will not wait for our inaction."

He points to his satchel; you can see it is full of herbs and small, colorful vials.
"I wander, looking for towns that can benefit from my knowledge... I have a lot to say about herbalism and healing. And it can save your life - as I have saved many myself. Would your healer be interested?"

"It warms my heart to hear that." He begins to speak more confidently. "These are difficult and complex arts - but they can be mastered.It simply requires the correct knowledge and the right materials, and if it can be done in the middle of a battlefield, as orc arrows fly over our heads, while we try to bring back our friends and brothers-in-arms from the cold grasp of..."

He's now staring off into the horizon.

"Forgive me, I digress. We have peace, but I fear your town might still be found by trouble. Be grateful that you have a capable healer that is also able to find, grow and tend to herbs of multiple types, for these are your most important resources."

"There are basically eight types of herbs. Healing, soothing and noxious are their main types and represent their most important property for use. Mild, robust and peculiar are quality enhancers and represent the complexity level of a product or recipe they're used for.
And there are also two other properties, Zesty - which means they're tasty and fragrant, popular in cooking! - or Pungent, which are usually bitter or very strong in flavor or smell, commonly used in brewing. It is important to have as many herbs as you can since they're useful for many things... But when talking about saving lives, healing and soothing herbs are your best friends."

"A Farmer can grow beautiful gardens, but only someone specialized with herbs like an Herbalist can truly unlock their potential by utilizing planters. There are many types of them, big and small, some for algae or water lilies, some for tree saplings... I'm sure you have your own by now, or at least want to! You should, indeed. And you also need an exploration garden to be able to find more seeds in the wilderness!"
He smiles. "You really want to collect them all, believe me! There's no better use than dealing with wounds of those that did battle to defend their homeland. It is quite possible that after battling, a hearthling will be wounded."

"There are many types of wounds, the most common ones being cuts, piercing wounds, and impact wounds. Each wound has a severity, some of which can heal over time on their own. And naturally, the tougher the enemies are, the more likely you are to be seriously wounded... unless you wear a lot of armor, of course." He shakes his platemail.
"Wearing armor will reduce the odds of being wounded in combat. And there are wounds that can come from other sources, like fires or extreme cold weather, which causes frostbite.
Each wound is unique, with the worst ones causing infections and other nasty side effects. But you can check on them when in doubt!"
Hovering the mouse over wound debuffs will provide you with a lot of information!

"That's where your healer and their herbs come in. When a hearthling is wounded and they know they can be treated - that is, there is proper medicine available - they'll head to a bed and wait for it. If you have comfortable beds made specifically for healing, these work even better, and I'm sure a Carpenter, Mason, or Potter can come up with something.

Your herbalist will know what medication to use as long as it is available, and if no specific medicine is present, they can at least recover some of their health with healing tonics that are cheaper to make. The specific medicines, craftable once your Herbalist has gained a little more experience, will always work on that type of wound. For example, any bandage will work for any cut."

"Well, yes. The caveat is that a high severity wound will need more than one of the simpler items to heal it, so having better medications is a way to get your people up again faster, because once treated, the patient must rest for hours before another application. While you can technically cover all your needs with basic stuff, like rough salves or coarse bandages, you'll probably want the best ones to keep your kin safer." He coughs.

"You'll need to deal with poisons, infections, and burns, too, all of which have their own requirements, so carefully read the information provided on each recipe! Medications can be automatically requested when someone gets wounded, but your best bet is to maintain a small stock."

"And you must. While the beginning of a warrior's life can be easy, with no more than some scrapes and bruises, wounds can get worse much faster than you might think. Being prepared is the best way to manage them. If you have a Cleric, they can provide support on the battlefield - like I did many years ago. But there is only so much you can do out there."

"The healing spells of clerics will keep your soldiers up and fighting, but only proper healing techniques like medications and rest will take away their wounds. A proficient cleric can learn how to help with these using their magic, but it's something very taxing and we can't do it all the time." He makes a humble face. "You'll have to prepare and provide indeed."

"So remember, my fellow: tend to herb planters for herbs; Provide shelter and beds for the wounded; Have a stock of medications and healing items; And that's it.

Even if you don't have everything you need, someone that is resting in bed and being treated with small tonics will already have a much better prognosis. They won't develop further infections or other negative effects if recently treated. Wounds reduce their maximum health, making them lesser fighters. Don't underestimate even minor wounds, because if they're stacked enough, the effects will be considerable. Healing is not impossible, it just needs preparation and dedication.
Do not disappoint your kin, my fellow. Do not leave your brothers and sisters without support..."
He stares off into nothing once more.

"It is possible. I've been wandering since the last wars, and I've been to many places and towns. Forgive me if I don't recall your face, I tend to focus on the needs of my kin - not their looks." He bows his head, slightly ashamed.
"Regardless of that, knowledge is knowledge - and I'm more than willing to share mine about herbalism and healing again, if you wish. It is my life's purpose."

"So be it. And thus another moment of enlightment has come to pass, hopefully for the improvement of the fair [str(i18n_data.town_name)]!"

He puts his hand on his heart and gestures to everyone.

"I hope our meeting has been as fruitful to you all as it has been to me. I thank you for the opportunity to share knowledge, and I humbly ask for only a day of shelter and a night of warmth by the fire, so I can regain my strength to continue wandering tomorrow."

dialog_nodes.gift_title: Someone left us a gift and a letter!

message.00:
"My dearie!

Thank you for your company and for being such a sweetie. I can't wait to tell my grandchildren about your settlement.
I've made you some food and, of course, some cookies with a little bit of love. May your ovens sing for generations to come! Farewell."

The gift package contains:

"Hey, friends!

As I write this, I'm about to leave on my boat. One must always follow the currents. I had a good time here and actually managed to fish a little during the evening!
I feel that the first fish from your town should stay where they belong, though. Hopefully we'll meet again and I'll bring lots of goods!
Stay safe!"

The gift package contains:

"Many greetings, pollito!

I've just left to meet my caravan and go home. The world needs Fernand and Fernand needs the world.
But I didn't want to leave without sharing one last thing to help you get started!

Keep on growing!
PS: Store that hunk o' hard coal well, it will be very useful in the future!"

The gift package contains:

"Many greetings, fellows.

The time has come for me to continue wandering across the hearthlands, looking for the ones that need my gifts.
These are trying times, so take this. It is only a simple set of curatives but should be enough to keep your kin in good shape. Be well!
And may Cid grant you all safety!"

The gift package contains:

bulletin_message.00:
A woman distractedly walks towards the town while scanning the horizon with a spyglass. Suddenly, she's startled by everyone.

"Oh, OH! Merling's beard! D-did you fall from the sky?! No, wait... You look quite normal." She shrugs. "Yes, I'm sorry, I might've trespassed without noticing..."

She retracts her spyglass into a smaller form and pockets it, making sure her conical hat is in place before waving to everyone with both hands.
"Hello, hello! I am Carina, from the Astrologer's Guild!"

"The Astrologer's Guild, the best guild! We study the stars, the cosmos, the sun, and the moon... all through intense observation of the night sky! We also play a bit of 'connect-the-dots' when it's not so intense..." Carina coughs.

"Anyway, I didn't mean to invade your settlement, no, no. I was traveling by this area a night or so ago when a bright star lit up the evening sky! It seemed to be going down in a glorious blaze somewhere around..." She ponders, looking around. "...here? Here! Tell me, you haven't heard or seen anything unusual, have you? Maybe a very long, twinkly peeeeeeeew from the sky?"

"I see, understandable. For most people there are far more interesting things down here than up there. But did you know that there's far more interesting things down there than up here? Wait... That sounded wrong."

She takes off her glasses and cleans them up with her robes, revealing pointy and funny-looking shoes.

"Sorry about that. The point is that I'm sure a meteorite has fallen somewhere around here, and it would be great if you could find it!"

"OH-YOU-DID?!" She gasps with excitement, almost dropping her starry conical hat.

"That is STELLAR! Can I take a look at it? Just a little look? Maybe lick it? For science, of course! And only if it's already cold; that-" She scratches the back of her head. "That wouldn't end well, haha, ehm..."

Everyone just stares at her.

"Is it a big one? Was it still smoking? They release a column of smoke for quite a while after they fall, very useful for finding them! If it's a big one, you can mine it out, you know! They're often rich in higher quality gold, stone... And something way better!"

"Well, yes!" She smiles proudly. "We at the Astrologer's Guild dedicate years of our lives to studying, understanding, and registering all things above this lush and flat world of ours!" She slowly gestures at the full expanse of the sky.

"Always keep an eye out for crashed meteorites! They're more likely to fall on nights filled with shooting stars; I'm sure you'll notice when such events happen... And remember, they will only happen after a clear day! So don't even bother when it's cloudy or raining."

She holds her chin for a second, thinking. "But yes, our findings regarding meteoric metals are astonishing! You wouldn't believe!"

"I can provide you with some notes, actually! I can tell you how to extract high quality iron from meteorites or, even better..." She seems very excited about the next bit. "Turn meteoric fragments into an incredibly strong metal, Starsteel!"

She seems happy to share the guild's knowledge. "And don't forget to go after fallen meteorites! They make a very peculiar sound, like magic! Or... bubbles. You'll certainly notice it, even if you don't get to see their fiery demise!"

She's briefly lost in thought before coming back with a rushed voice. "So, right! Starsteel, stellar knowledge, bada bing, bada boom, yes?"

"Huh! Maybe! I'm a bit distracted, sorry about that... Perhaps we did indeed meet before! If so, am I safe to assume that you already know the secrets of meteorites, shooting stars and the art of crafting Starsteel?"

She grins, a bit embarrassed for being confused.

"Because if you do, I'll just hang around a bit and leave in the morning! Otherwise I could tell you about it all right now!"

"Brilliant! You don't mind if I stay a bit longer, do you?" She seems very eager for some reason.

"I think it might be nice and starry tonight! And this place seems like a prime location for stargazing! I might even feel like sharing an astrology tale or two around the fire; who knows?"

She seems to remember something."Oh, and don't worry about the recipes I'll teach today... Others in our guild have additional knowledge they can share; I'll let them know where to find you in the future!"

astrologer_gift.recipe_unlock: The Blacksmith has unlocked recipes with meteoric fragments and a Starsteel sword!

bulletin_message.00:
A young lady clad in chainmail and with a bright red cloak over her shoulders approaches with strong, decisive steps. She seems disappointed.

"Aww, no! There're already people here... Oh well." She recomposes from her disappointment and resumes speaking in a gentler tone. "Greetings, friends! You may call me Mara Loft, famous explorer, tomb raider, and currently an archeologist working for the capital's Phoenix Empire Museum."

"I've been following some old maps from the Museum collection, hoping that they might bring me to some new and exciting discoveries!" She shrugs. "However I didn't expect this place to be settled already; maps take a while to be updated, so of course I can't really interfere with that..."

She continues after a brief pause. "But the Museum is always interested in registering new findings and the locations of old ruins for future research! Have you seen anything... like maybe some hidden crypt?"

msg2.choice_000: Yes, we found an Ancient Crypt!

bulletin_message.00: "Great! I'd really appreciate if you could point me the location of it later." She smiles. "According to the old documents we have, this area was the resting place of some really honorable warriors from the Phoenix Empire. Chances are you might find fragments of armor and other ancient relics by exploring these places! And who knows? Some of the ancient fragments you find might still have some of their magic..."

"Indeed!" She swings her fists in the air, excited. "I do love some dungeon delving myself, but according to the Museum code, we won't take artifacts or anything from lands that are already settled. But we're always accepting donations, of course!"

She rummages through her satchel, looking for something.

"Now that your settlement is in our official map, we might visit again in the future... Perhaps even before you're all dead and it's just an archaeological site! But for now, please accept this gift. I think it might be helpful to your people... And don't worry, this is just a copy!"

She removes a scroll from the satchel and unfurls it. It depicts a colorful portrait of a strong warrior clad in beautiful lamellar armor.

"This scroll has some translated information on the making and enchanting of the legendary Palatine Guard armor. You might've heard about them in writings from the Church of Plenty; they're called 'Paladins' nowadays..."

She grins. "An innocent translation error. Either way, I wrote the translation and copied the original drawing myself, and I'm sure a Blacksmith would love to read this!"

She ponders for a moment.

"Oh! You're absolutely correct, I think. I talked about ancient ruins and armor fragments, and showed you the old illustrations of the Phoenix Palatine Guard, did I not? Or was that someone else? I can always repeat all that, if you'd like!

...or if you don't remember it..."

She smiles.

"Great!" She eagerly looks around.

"You wouldn't mind if I stay for a day or so, would you? I just want to take a look around, see if I spot any new ruins not yet added to the Museum catalog... I'll depart tomorrow! And remember, if you ever visit the capital, make sure to check out our collection!"

archeologist_gift.recipe_unlock: The Blacksmith has unlocked the legendary 'Phoenix Paladin Regalia' recipe!

hunting.hungry_woodchuck_raid: A family of Woodchucks is coming for the tree farms, orchards and bushes!

msg1.bulletin_title: Someone approaches wearing a comfy coat and a very long cap...

bulletin_message.00:
"Oh! Oh, oh, oh! Tomtee sees someone, finally!" She seems particularly happy about finding your town. "You must help Tomtee, she needs someone to... No, wait. Maybe you cannot help. But maybe you can! Here, Tomtee needs something fast, she... Uh..."

She pats herself all over, looking for something in her many pockets.

"Where did Tomtee put it?"

"Alright, Tomtee needs... crystal..."
She looks at you for an instant and feels ashamed.
"Oh. Right. Tomtee is sorry, was all over herself. Name be Tomtee the Late, and me works for Frostfather!"

She proudly smiles, leaning forward as if her coat was some sort of recognizable uniform.

"What?" She looks down to her own chest, noticing something is missing. "Nooo! Tomtee lost it, she lost her badge! Ugh..."

"Me can't believe this..."

"It's okay... badge is least of Tomtee's problems, anyway... Me probably not deserving anymore..." She looks down, moving one of her feet back and forth for a while before looking up again.
"Tomtee crashed enchanted sled. Was supposed to arrive couple days ago with letters and requests she was carrying. But no, owl passed in front of her, big owl! Or was it goose? Dunno!"

"Tomtee saw it, Tomtee dodged, boom! Tomtee crashed..."

"Me likes fixing idea, but..."

Just as quickly she looks sad again.

"Tomtee unsure you can help. Frostfather uses very special power to enchant sleds, very deep and ancient, carved out of nature itself."

"Yes! But no worry with that, there probably nothing your town can do for sled..." She seems very disappointed. "Tomtee lost, she not even know if she be welcome back home... Disappointed Frostfather, and friends will mock her forever, as if mocking her because tooth slightly bigger not enough..."

She points to her own face, mumbling something.

"Frostfeast ruined now... Well, at least for people that now not get presents and... Wait! Me has idea!"

"Oh, oh, yes! This is great, great idea indeed. This is best idea since hot cocoa!"
She goes back to patting her pockets until she finally finds a large patch of stitched notes and lists.
"Here! Tomtee knew she hadn't lost you!"

She kisses the papers. "Eww. Pff. Reindeer fur, sorry. Tomtee allergic."

She smiles, showing off the papers. "These are lists and requests for Frostfather from all over region!"

"Aaaaand... Me cannot take them to him because your town not able to repair sled... But your town able to craft presents and stuff like that, right?!"
She starts going through the lists.
"Look, it nothing too complicated. Me give you requests and deliver presents, and you all do the crafting and wrapping! And as you help Tomtee, Tomtee can give you special Frostfeast crafting recipes that she know she have somewhere..."

She extends her little goblin hand.

"What do you think?"

"Oh, well... Tomtee thought this was nice opportunity to interact with others... Share spirit of Frostfeast... But she understand. Tomtee sees your town not able to help her, or not want to and that okay... But me thought maybe you all want help others, and..."

She coughs, showing some papers in one of her pockets.

"And earning special rewards like Frostfeast crafting recipes..."

"You... You know about it?!" She looks both surprised and grateful. "This good, this very good. Spares Tomtee much explaining things she not supposed to talk about..."
She starts grimacing, scratching the back of her head.
"And Tomtee not exactly good at staying quiet... But me glad you know. Tomtee assumes you learned from underground bunnies? Or dwarves? Ugh, Tomtee not like dwarves... Their chimneys way too deep and dirty."
She ponders for a second.

"Oh, well... But even with Hearth magic, Tomtee afraid she still need new leyline crystal... She not think you have one, right?"

msg2b.dialog_title: There's a glow on her eyes!

bulletin_message.00:
"Yes, Frostfather! Benevolent soul of Frostfeast, or that what most people believe." She looks confused for a second.

"Wait, of course you know Frostfeast, right? Season of giving, warmth, feasting? Me means, everyone celebrates Frostfeast!" She then smiles, continuing.

"And it be Tomtee and her tribe who making it happen every year! In secret bringing joy to all... Lotsa generations of loyalty to man who saved us from cold, bitter end long ago... First act of giving and sharing of warmth! Us his loyal followers since then... Not that Tomtee still has badge to prove it anymore..."

And once more she gets sad, looking away.

"Alright, Tomtee has set up small fire for resting... Me stays nearby, going back and forth when needed."

She smiles.

"Me thinks me has all lists and requests ready, us start soon! You iz ready?"

msg1.choice_001: Wait, tell me more about it!

bulletin_message.00:
"No worry! Tomtee explain everything!"
She holds out the papers, showing them in detail.
"So, there basically two types of requests - some just ask for presents, so us finish these easily just getting them anything, really."
She giggles.
"Tomtee means, anything that be not like coal or rocks, of course... And there also some specific requests, letters of people that really wanted something. These need more diverse range of crafting skills, but Tomtee is sure us figure it out!"

She rolls her eyes.
"And, of course, if something too complicated... You can cancel it and request new assignment!"

"You have Frostfeast spirit! Now, just give Tomtee time to organize and choose assignment and you hear from Tomtee shortly. Me thinks it best if us focus on one by one, so every request you fulfill, just give me time to send it away and bring you one more!"

She punches the air in excitement.

"Woo, us got this! Tomtee sure those people not minding, uh... getting Frostfeast presents bit earlier, right?"

"At least they getting presents!"

msg1.bulletin_title: Tomtee returns, and she looks more excited than ever!

bulletin_message.00:
"Us make it! Us solve problems! Me just checked and us complete all deliveries needed! All but one, actually..."
She grabs one last piece of paper. The writing on it looks like a very long list...

"Well, uhm... This one bit complicated, but Tomtee supposes it possible for problem solvers! Nothing too hard, right?" Before she finishes, she looks even more worried. "Oh, actually missing last page, Tomtee misplaced it on sled... Wait here, Tomtee come right back!"

msg1.bulletin_title: Tomtee returns again, she seems desperate now...

bulletin_message.00:
"Hey, friends... We have biggest problem... Ugh..."
She throws her many pages of paper up in the air, despondent.
"It not there, it not anywhere! Me lost it!"

You can tell that she's about to cry.

"Tomtee lost it, Tomtee ruin Frostfeast for so many people... Tomtee disappoint everyone back home... Disappoint Frostfather..."
She looks down as a tear rolls over her cheek.

"No, you haven't and you won't."

A strong, rugged voice echoes from nearby. At the same time, it inexplicably feels very soft and gentle, almost as if all the kindness in the world were engraved on those words.

"Look here, little one."

She looks up, wiping the tears from her face. You can tell there's immense joy on her eyes - but also worry.

"Not real! Frostfather... You here? Is really you?!"

"Ha, ha, oh ho ho!"

He laughs out loud, a laughter that immediately makes everyone around feel comfy and well. "Of course I'm here, little one. I have been watching what you and this brave little town have been doing for a while, now... Did you think we wouldn't notice you didn't arrive back home?"

He smiles at her and she immediately runs towards him, getting swept up and sheltered in his huge, warm embrace.

"It's ok, little one. You have not failed me, quite the opposite!"

msg5.bulletin_title: Tomtee and the Frostfather are reunited!

bulletin_message.00:
"What you mean?" She steps back and starts questioning things.

"You not disappointed? Tomtee means... she broke sled and also lost badge... Oh, and lost some lists... Lists very important, you always say how important!"

"Tomtee might have replaced some gifts with coals too..."

"Things lost? I have it all here - don't worry!"
He kneels down to be closer to her height.
"Yes, Tomtee the Late... You did all of those things. But do you know what else you did?" She wipes her face again, still smiling. "You proved to everyone that the spirit of Frostfeast - what it really, really means - is much more than the presents, the traditions, or the decorations anyone has for it..."

He then places his hand on his heart as she repeats the gesture on her own heart.

"The real meaning of Frostfeast is here: it's spreading the warm light that each of us carries onto one another."

Tomtee cries, but she's now crying happy tears! She smiles to everyone and finally to the Frostfather.

"So Tomtee not fail? Tomtee not ruined Frostfeast?" She jumps in joy, celebrating. "Tomtee made Frostfather happy and made many, many people happy, too!"
She stops, looking at everyone now.

"Tomtee so very grateful she ran into best town in world... Us save Frostfeast together, all of us!"

msg8.bulletin_title: The Frostfather has an announcement to make...

bulletin_message.00:
"Ha, ha, oh ho ho! Yes, indeed!" His gaze passes warmly across everyone present.
"What Tomtee said is true: your town has shown that it has remarkable spirit and benevolence. All of this happened for a reason, from her sled crash to this very moment..."

He looks at her again.
"And I believe that this reason was to help you, more than anyone else, to discover who you truly are. Tomtee, you shall no longer be known as 'the Late!' I think from now on we should call you... Tomtee the Kind!"

Everyone claps as the small goblin blushes and covers her face under her long cap.
"Now let's celebrate!"

"Nothing is a coincidence, dear town. Stories of what happened here will spread, and eventually, this will be yet another Frostfeast story..." He smiles. "I'm sure you've heard many of those tales yourself. Are they real, are they not? Not even I know anymore! Ha, ha, oh ho ho!" he laughs, but he quickly recovers and adopts a more serious tone.

"All of them do start somewhere, though. Never stop believing in the spirit of Frostfeast." He nods to everyone around and starts walking away. "We go back to our home, now. Thank you all!"

He looks back once more.
"Tomtee, it's time."

She comes closer to everyone.

"Well, Tomtee thinks it all over now. Time to say good bye." She tries to smile, but one last tear rolls down her face. "Tomtee always grateful to this town, and think of it always!" Everyone smiles, trying to cheer her up.

"Must go, or me be 'the Late' again! Please not ever forget Tomtee and... who knows..."

She starts walking away behind the Frostfather.

"Next Frostfeast, look up to sky!" ‚ú®

quest_timed_items.title: Tomtee brings a gift request!
quest_timed_items.waiting_text: Tomtee will be back in [str(i18n_data.hour_counter)] [str(i18n_data.period)] to retrieve [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)] ([str(i18n_data.req_1.quantity)]) as stated in the gift list!
quest_timed_items.return_greetings_positive:
Tomtee returns and is ready to collect the [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)] as requested. She'll give us [str(i18n_data.reward_number)] [str(i18n_data.reward_item)] for the help!

You must click the item and use the 'Learn!' command to unlock the recipe. If inside a storage container, use the town inventory screen to interact with it!
quest_timed_items.return_greetings_negative: Tomtee is back but you didn't manage to acquire the [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)] in time. Let's move on...

quest_1.trade_details:
'Greetings, Frostfather! We never asked anything, but things have been better... This has been a complicated year and we're struggling a bit. But everything would be better if we had [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)]! Thank you and Merry Frostfeast!'

Tomtee will be back in [str(i18n_data.num_days)] days to collect this gift if we accept! And, as usual, she'd give us [str(i18n_data.reward_number)] [str(i18n_data.reward_item)]!

quest_2.trade_details:
'Hey there, Frostfather! Things this year have been so-so. I hope this letter reaches you well! I know we asked a lot last year, but I'd really appreciate if we could have [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)] this year! Merry Frostfeast!'

Tomtee will be back in [str(i18n_data.num_days)] days to collect this gift if we accept! And she'd give us [str(i18n_data.reward_number)] [str(i18n_data.reward_item)]!

quest_3.trade_details:
'Hey, Frostfather... I know I don't write every year but I hope you're in good health! This has been another one of those years and I'm not sure if we'll last much longer... If only we could have [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)]! This would help a lot... Merry Frostfeast.'

Tomtee will be back in [str(i18n_data.num_days)] days to collect this gift if we accept! And she'd give us [str(i18n_data.reward_number)] [str(i18n_data.reward_item)]!

quest_4.trade_details:
'Greetings, Frostfather! You know who I am, and I won't hide that I've not been very kind this year... But things are rough! Those are troubled times, and we do what we can to go on... I could really use [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)], by the way! See you next year and Merry Frostfeast!'

Tomtee will be back in [str(i18n_data.num_days)] days to collect this gift if we accept! And she'd give us [str(i18n_data.reward_number)] [str(i18n_data.reward_item)]!

quest_5.trade_details:
'Hello, Frostfather! I'm writing with a clear conscience to receive your blessing this Frostfeast. We really need [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)], and it would be amazing if you could help with that... I appreciate it! Merry Frostfeast!'

Tomtee will be back in [str(i18n_data.num_days)] days to collect this gift if we accept! And she'd give us [str(i18n_data.reward_number)] [str(i18n_data.reward_item)]!

amberstone.title: Tomtee brings a gift request from Clan Amberstone!
amberstone.trade_details:
'We extend the paw of friendship, Frostling! Ever since our great Warren has befriended kind surface-dwellers, we've been introduced to several delicacies and wonders! We can't stop thinking about how much we'd love to have [str(i18n_data.want_number)] [str(i18n_data.want_item)] this year. Is that how we are supposed to ask for it? We hope so! Many hops to you and happy Frostfeast!'

Tomtee will be back in [str(i18n_data.num_days)] days to collect this gift if we accept! And she'd give us a [str(i18n_data.reward_item)] from the Warren itself!

quest_frostfeast_presents.title: Tomtee brings a list of presents!

quest_1.text: Let's give a better Frostfeast time to those people!

quest_2.text: Everyone deserves presents, especially the ones that can't afford them!

quest_3.text: We'll spread happiness across the swamps too!

quest_4.text: Ohhh, that's a lot of wishes... But we can do this!

quest_5.text: This will be their best catch this year!

quest_reward.title: Tomtee received the presents!
quest_reward.message:
Tomtee shall deliver these presents to their destinations as soon as possible.

For our help, we're rewarded with some crafting recipes. You must click it and use the 'Learn!' command to unlock the recipe. If inside a container, use the town inventory screen to interact with it!

You receive:

quest_reward_2.message:
Tomtee shall deliver these presents to their destinations as soon as possible.

For our help, we're rewarded with some crafting recipes. You must click it and use the 'Learn!' command to unlock the recipe. If inside a container, use the town inventory screen to interact with it!

bulletin_message.00:
"Many greetings, town! I'm Dwalek Cinderheart!" The other dwarf immediately follows her companion. "Karuna Steelfist!" And then they continue in unison. "At yer service!"

Everyone close by stops for the rare sight. Other than the occasional trading journey, very few things will draw dwarves away from their lands and underground cities...

"Please forgive us if this is an untimely arrival, but we have a, uh..." He hesitates while trying to keep his composure. "Let's call it an urgent trade offer!"

"Nae, please! I understand our sudden arrival can be... sudden." He coughs, uncertain of his words. "Or I'm fearin' we might nae be welcome... But ye must at least hear what we have t' say, it's very important!"

Karuna seems rather disappointed, but interrupts him. "Look, listen to 'im, please! There are lives in danger!"

msg2.dialog_title: They look a bit more relieved...

bulletin_message.00:
"Oh, aye! I knew we could count on the support of our not-so-distant surface cousins, eh?"
Karuna rolls her eyes.
"Well, y'see... We're from a nearby settlement, it's mostly a family business, not really a city. Lots o' good ore and precious gems to be found in this region..." He gestures to the ground all around him, and then the distant mountains. "But we're quite far from any o' the Underhomes and, well... We've unfortunately had a wee bit of a... mining accident."

He looks down, shaking his head.

"The Underhomes, aye. That's how we Mountain Folk refer to the main settlements of each of our major clans." she explains with a glow in her eyes.

"Our Folk is formed by the allegiance and conformity o' several clans under a single banner, ruled by a leader elected by members of all the Underhomes. Our power comes from every single one of us, and if our leadership i' nae strong enough, we replace it at will!" Dwalek nods vigorously in agreement.

"An Underhome will usually 'elp out with this manner o' trouble, but we're too far to rely on 'em now..."

"Dinnae worry about the details or anythin' though!" He laughs, trying to cheer up the conversation again. "It's nothin' serious, we just need a bit o' help in... helpin'! Ye can trust a Cinderheart, aye, we've always been great investors!"

He smiles, gesturing for Karuna to come forward. "Here, me loyal guard'll fill ya in further."

"We're in need o' certain medications and the healin' items contained in this list..." She grabs a piece of paper, offering it forward. "And we're willin' to give a valuable assortment of ore and coal from our mines, quality stuff, I guarantee!"

She takes a small rock from her backpack and holds it up; it glints like gold.

"Indeed! Shiny indeed! Hah!" He laughs out loud, holding his belly. "Ye'll never find better ore yeself, I can assure ye o' that!"

He smiles and begins to pace energetically. "Folk always tell me 'Dwalek, dinnae waste yer time with surface dwellers, it ain't worth it.' Bucket o' toadstools, I say! I always knew we could count on this fine town!"

He turns to you and offers a handshake.
"Do we have a deal?"

healing_items_delivery_quest.title: Healing Items for the Dwarves
healing_items_delivery_quest.text: Dwalek Cinderheart and his guard, Karuna Steelfist, really need those items to help their people!

ore_reward.title: Karuna brings the Ore!
ore_reward.message:
"Thank ye very much, surface dweller... I just 'ope..." She stops for a moment, looking very concerned before shrugging it off. "I 'ope it'll be enough. Mr. Dwalek sends 'is regards..."

She departs, leaving behind a large sack.
It contains:

bulletin_message.00: "Greetings again, surface dwellers!" They approach, but their excitement isn't really convincing this time. They look very tired. "We return with another proposition! Or a request, rather..."

"We bring sad news. Unfortunately, the medicine ye provided was nae enough. It did 'elp a lot... however," he pauses, considering his words before continuing. Karuna is completely silent. "Well, the issue is that our Grower was wounded in the accident so we cannae really use the tonics properly... And we need some other things, some very specific things for the next round of, uh..."

He stops and scratches his beard for a moment.

"I mean, for the ones affected..."

"Aye, Growers." she asserts, looking at Dwalek. "They be our physicians and healers, the ones that tend t' our plants an' mushrooms an' trees, and all other forms o' natural life an' magic."

She discreetly smiles at everyone's reactions.

"I know a wee bit of it meself, runs in me kin, although I followed another vein. It's a very old tradition, something like yer 'herbalists', I reckon."

"Aye, well..." He briefly pauses. "Anyway, another accident, and there might be more! We found a very unstable tunnel, it's provin' itself difficult - even for us, heh!"

He gestures behind himself, and you can see that this time they've brought along a large pack. "We need somethin' a wee bit different this time."

He looks to Karuna. "How can I explain it?"

"I've got this, Mr. Dwalek." She points to the pack as well. "This time around we've brought some mushroom planters with a very special product of ours, the Glowshroom. We need it for... complex concoctions." She looks away.

"We need some o' these, but our Grower cannae really tend to them right now and I'm quite... busy."

Karuna seems really sad, but Dwalek gently nudges her to continue. "I've brought some notes for yer herbalist on 'ow to take care o' them and what to do, I'm sure they'll be useful."

"Allow me to apologize. We're very tired and stressed with all that is happenin' - I mean, happened!" He smiles weakly. "We just need some Glowshroom, and I'm sure yer herbalist is capable o' growin' them; Karuna's notes will help with that! We'll be back when they're ready an' bring ya some extra ore an' riches for yer 'elp, o' course!"

He offers another handshake. "Deal?"

glowshroom_planters.title: Karuna brings the Planters
glowshroom_planters.message:
"Here they are, and here're me notes," she says, dropping the pack and shuffling some papers. "It should be enough to take care o' them. Just place 'em somewhere and yer herbalist will know what to do... I must go now, we'll be back soon! I hope..."

She departs. The pack contains:

glowshroom_delivery_quest.title: Glowshroom for the Dwarves
glowshroom_delivery_quest.text: We need to provide them with some exotic, glowing mushrooms... And make sure to undeploy and return the planters, of course!

ore_reward_2.title: Dwalek returns!
ore_reward_2.dialog_title: He brings a bag of ore!
ore_reward_2.message:
"We meet again, surface dwellers!" he says, genuinely happy to see that you've harvested their Glowshrooms. "Very good, very good indeed. This'll be very helpful! Now let me drop this inconveniently heavy sack..."

With an effort, he releases it on the ground.

"Whew... Karuna couldnae come today, unfortunately. I must return with these now. Thank ye very much - for everything!"

He leaves in a hurry. The sack contains:

bulletin_message.00:
"Greetings again!" Dwalek recovers his breath a little.

Karuna stands next to him, and even her armor looks more ragged than before.

"I understand that by now ye dinnae expect us to return. However..."

"Aye, I'm afraid there was another accident. But this was probably the... last one."

Karuna turns around, eyeing their surroundings. He notices her with a glance, but looks back at you.

"We really appreciate the help ye provided us with those items, and the mushrooms..."

"Well, I think that... Perhaps it would be best if we could take yer herbalist with us for a couple o' days. It'll be quick, ye have me word!"

Karuna immediately turns around and stares at him. He acknowledges her and privately gestures something, but continues speaking.

"I... I'm afraid it would be the best way to go, that way they can 'elp us with everythin' we need!"

"Look, it's all good," Dwalek says, trying to smile. "We'll come back some other time, I'm sure ye'll need to talk and decide first..." He nods.

"But it would be really appreciated! I'm sure ye understand. Healers are very important and we need all the help we can get now!"

"Brilliant! We'll return tomorrow, then." He scratches the back of his head, thinking for a moment.

"We'll be goin' now, thank ye for the support! We'll bring ye some payment upfront this time!"

They leave, but Karuna stares at your town banner for a long time before running behind him.

"Hey there..." She keeps glancing over her shoulder, clearly worried. "I'm here to ask something of ye. I know it's nae me place to ask anything, but... I must!"

She looks around, taken by an intense emotion.

"I must warn ye!"

"Nae matter what Mr. Dwalek says... Do nae send anyone with us tomorrow!" She breathes heavily. "I'm serious, do nae send anyone! Ye'll be sendin' 'em to their doom if ye do!"

Everyone around reacts with surprise and shock.

"There... there was no mining accident. He's been lyin' all along, the... ugh!" She clenches her fists.

"We dug into a monster burrow... A biggun. They've been beatin' us day after day, we even... lost some of our best already." A single tear rolls down her face, but she quickly wipes it away.

"We cannae hold 'em back, we're just... delayin' the inevitable! And now he wants ye to risk one o' yer own as well - without knowin'!"

"The truth is that we should've asked the Underhomes for 'elp. We could've. But..."

She looks guilty about she's about to say.

"He has nae rights over those lands, he has nae permits for runnin' such an operation. He's afraid, afraid of what would happen to 'im and to the Cinderheart family name if our settlement is exposed." She gets angry again.

"But it doesn't matter anymore! We need help, real help! We need our Folk!"

"Nae, I cannae do that! I mean... really?" She hesitates. "I want to, but I'm afraid... I'm just a member o' his retinue, I... dunno if I can."

She looks around. "Nae alone. Would ye help me?" For the first time in days, she looks hopeful again.

"Aye, yer right. It must be done! We'll do it tomorrow!"

msg1.bulletin_title: The Dwarves are back for the Herbalist!

bulletin_message.00:
"Hello, town! Well, we're short on time... So I'll get straight to the point! Did ye consider our offer? I've brought a nice amount of ores this time..."

He looks back but Karuna is just standing there, empty-handed.

"Wait, where is the sack?"

"Enough, Mr. Dwalek! They..." She looks up at all the people gathered around.

"They know it all. I told 'em yesterday, after we went back to our camp." She walks closer and looks into his eyes, almost begging for him to see reason.

"Nae more lies, sir... These people have 'elped us with so much already, this i' nae fair to them. This i' nae fair to any of us!"

Dwalek is suddenly very upset. He lifts a hand up to his head, almost panicking. "Ye did what? Karuna, ye did what?!" He looks all around, realizing that everyone knows. "I cannae believe it! Karuna, how could ye?" He seems desperate now.

"If the clan leaders find out, if the King finds out... Me family, our name, our mines..." He looks back to you. "Nae, we must find a solution for this, we must gather more people and..."

"Mr. Dwalek... Dwalek. Stop." He calms down for a moment, listening. "I've served ye for many years, I know ye have a good heart. Yer father's a great dwarf, and while this'll hurt him deeply..." She looks back, pointing to the mountains.

"Lettin' our folk suffer an' perish out o' pride and profits? This'd break 'is heart e'en more." She smiles. "Do the right thing, Dwalek. It's enough, too many have suffered already. I've come this far with ye, I've agreed with all o' this, and I'll face justice with ye."

"Ye be right. We owe 'em that much." He looks up again. "I'm a Cinderheart, I'm a son o' me father. I won't be carved into the granite walls of the Halls o' Memory as a liar and a greedy fool!" He looks down. "Thank ye, Karuna, for helpin' me see this... I know it's far too late, but we shall seek help from the Underhomes immediately."

He then looks up at you again. "And I'm sorry to all of ye. I'll make sure to express how helpful and friendly ye've been, and that no grudge'll be held against yer town."

msg4.choice_000: You did what you believed was right.

bulletin_message.00:
Karuna watches as Dwalek apologizes and starts walking away. "I'll make sure he'll be honest and that our people'll get the support they deserve. Please, do nae hate him. I know he's a good dwarf. He just thinks he needs to prove 'imself in all the wrong ways." She smiles.

"We'll be goin' now, but I wanted to leave these with ye." She gives you all her notes and instructions on mushroom planters. "If ye have a Blacksmith, they can provide the brass plates. Ye'll need 'em for these plans!"

She starts walking away. "Thank ye, surface dwellers... friends. Wish us good fortune!"
